profile.name: Simon Weizman
profile.headline: Full-stack Web Developer and UCF Computer Science Student

summary: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua.

description: Working in a team of 5 people using Flask and MongoDB to create tools for student hackathons.
Using Agile Methodology in the team.
Collaborate with front end and mobile teams to ensure the quality of the final product.
Design and maintained unit tests in collaboration with team members to ensure that the code functions properly.
Assisted in deployment using GitHub Actions, Kubernetes, and Nginx.
Developed a player management system utilizing an SQL database which enhanced the player experience and assisted in managing the player hierarchy.
Designed custom UI that integrated existing features to assist players and staff in managing characters and the server.
Cooperated with staff and players to increase player retention during down-time by 50%.
Documented the steps necessary to configure the different features on the server.
Maintained and managed the serverÎé}s code and database.
Part of a team of counselors, whose goal was to create a safe and fun environment where kids can learn about up-to-date technology in video game design, engineering, coding, and computer graphics.
Taught multiple computer programs to children at the beginning, intermediate, and advanced levels, including: Python and Tinker CAD
Supported campers through the learning process ensuring a fun and successful experience

projects.name: Verum Interactive Starmap
projects.description: An interactive starmap for Arcadum's world of Verum. Art is by Yowto with permission.

projects.name: Web Email Client
projects.description: Basically a Gmail/Outlook Clone architected with NodeJS and Express, etc. to help me learn more about Full-Stack Development and best practices for production.

projects.name: Personal Portfolio Website
projects.description: My personal website has been created by me; however, it is not-responsive and it is sorely out of date so I am currently deciding between 4 designs for the website, 3 of them based on Bootstrap 4.

projects.name: Why don't people format their numbers browser extension
projects.description: I created a Google Chrome browser extension using JavaScript to help me read large, especially unformatted numbers.

projects.name: Personal Homelab Server
projects.description: I owned, maintained, and administered an old Dell Poweredge R710 Server that I purchased from E-bay. I deployed the server in my home running Proxmox VE as it was a free and flexible environment which I utilized to learn more about server administration/management.

projects.name: First ML - Ai plays Snake
projects.description: My first Machine Learning Project, a failed attempt to make the computer play snake.

projects.name: PyChessbot
projects.description: A program to play chess architected with the PyGame framework and written in Python, originally built for the APCSP 2019 Create Task

education.description: Currently enrolled as a Computer Science major.
Participated in FTC, Science Olympiad, and Skills USA.
